DataElement.preferredName: CD4 Antigen Laboratory Procedure Diagnosis Result Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for result of CD4 Antigen lab test drawn at the time of diagnosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: CD4 Antigen Laboratory Procedure Diagnosis Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: CD4 Antigen, encoded by the CD4 gene, is a T-cell surface glycoprotein. CD4 has a role in cell-cell interactions and may act in signal transduction. CD4 is a accessory protein for MHC class-II antigen/T-cell receptor interaction and functions to initiate or augment the early phase of T-cell activation. CD4 enhances T-cell sensitivity to antigen and binds to LCK, which phosphorylates CD3-zeta. CD4 Antigen also serves as an HIV receptor, binding directly to the envelope protein gp120 on HIV. (From LocusLink, OMIM and NCI)_Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: CD4 Antigen, encoded by the CD4 gene, is a T-cell surface glycoprotein. CD4 has a role in cell-cell interactions and may act in signal transduction. CD4 is a accessory protein for MHC class-II antigen/T-cell receptor interaction and functions to initiate or augment the early phase of T-cell activation. CD4 enhances T-cell sensitivity to antigen and binds to LCK, which phosphorylates CD3-zeta. CD4 Antigen also serves as an HIV receptor, binding directly to the envelope protein gp120 on HIV. (From LocusLink, OMIM and NCI):A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: T-cell surface glycoprotein CD4 (458 aa, ~51 kDa) is encoded by the human CD4 gene. This protein plays a role in antigen recognition and HIV entry.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the value as a percentage of 100.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Head and Neck cancer with HIV clinical assessment CRF from MD Anderson SPOREs.
